node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: Meandering rows of saplings impede your progress as the path seems to try to envelop you in foliage. Glancing northeast to get your bearings you see mountain brush beginning to take over the landscape. Occasionally, as you trudge along, your feet scuff up bits of dirt and clay.

node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: The rusted remains of an iron wagon, long abandoned by its owner, lay to one side of the path.

node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: The road's never-ending battle to survive the onslaught of the foliage seems to be a losing one at this particularly overgrown stretch. The rhythmic buzzing of insects serves as a reminder that, to some, this place is home.

The road's never-ending battle to survive the onslaught of the foliage seems to be a losing one at this particularly overgrown stretch. The rythmic buzzing of insects serves as a reminder that, to some, this place is home.

node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: A single pine stands, aloof and deserted, like a lone soldier after the battle, forgotten but yet on guard. Gnarled and twisted roots cling to the poor soil in a desperate grasp, yet this guardian still manages to provide a place for a small nest. The road widens as it winds to the north.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: The road here is composed of a chocolate-brown clay, cracked and chipped in places where it has dried after a season of heavy rains. From here it wends its way through hills covered in dry scrub, dropping from sight as it ducks behind a bend in the distance. To the north rises a range of stony mountains, their heights dominated by one particularly tall, looming crag whose shadow falls heavily upon the lesser hills around it.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: A rockslide of mud and stone almost seems to have brought an entire mountain to its knees a few paces to the west.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: The hard-packed dirt of the road has been broken into a thick layer of loose dust by the passage of many feet and hooves. An occasional roadside footprint, nearly knee-deep in hardened clay, indicates that mud must be a real problem in times of heavy rain.

node.name: Foothills, Abandoned Road
node.description: The path underfoot is overgrown with weeds and almost completely covered with dried, fallen branches yet still feels surprisingly firm. A few pine saplings off to one side struggle to push up through the heavy soil.

node.name: Foothills, Stony Incline
node.description: Taking the opportunity to examine the distant countryside, large green forests in the southwest, flatlands to the south and the large ocean expanse to the southeast all catch the eye. All seem more attractive than the forbidding set of cliffs up ahead.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: Tree-dotted hillsides rise on both sides of the path, providing ample high ground and cover for would-be attackers. The road here is mostly flat as it meanders along the valley floor, although there is the slightest incline to the north. One especially large tree lies fallen near the edge of the road, its roots helplessly exposed.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: The road takes a sharp bend here where it begins to slope more steeply to the west. The rough hew of the road's northern wall and the beginnings of a dropoff to the southern valley floor indicate that the path here was not created by the simple passing of travellers, but was instead purposely cut into the hillside.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: The hard, brown clay of the road is pitted and rutted where it has been traveled during heavy rains. Although most of the footprints in the road are from human-like creatures or domesticated animals, there is on occasion a large print of a four-toed creature which appears to have a set of rather pointy claws.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: The path takes a sharp east-northeast turn where it contorts to follow the ridge of the hill above. The bend offers a fine vantage point for watching the brush-covered valley to the west, far past which can be seen the stony fist of Sorrow's Reach, thrusting angrily into the sky.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: A tall, regal pine stands watch here over a bend in the road formed by the tapered end of a ridgeline stretching off to the east. The vegetation in the valley below, somewhat dry and brown to the southwest, transitions into a deep green as it nears the valley floor to the north.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: A thick jungle of dry brush covers the hillside bordering the southern edge of the road, while downslope to the north lies an impenetrable mass of vine-laden oaks. Although the gathering of trees seems somewhat thinner to the east, the dense vegetation makes travel via the road your only real option.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: Tall, moss-covered conifers rub shoulders with lush, green oak on the slopes bordering both sides of the road. An occasional glimpse through the curtain of trees on the northern downslope reveals the path to be paralleling a river. To the east you can see a break in the trees where the road turns to march down the hillside below.

node.name: Foothills, Road
node.description: Tall pines stand in silent vigil at a sharp west-north curve in the road. Steep hills curve protectively above to the south and east, while to the north the landscape drops sharply as it descends to meet the river below. A slight smell of charred wood hangs upon the air.

node.name: Foothills, Campsite
node.description: Charred branches and the occasional ring of blackened stones indicate that this area is used as a campsite. The lack of ground vegetation and presence of many footprints in the soil suggest that the grounds are well-frequented. A wide dirt path runs through the campsite, leading from a steep hill to the south down to the riverbank.

node.name: Foothills, South Riverbank
node.description: A clear blue river flows shallow and wide over a multitude of rounded stones. On the far bank, a great jumble of earth stretches up to a stone road paralleling the river to the west. A wide path of hard-packed soil climbs its way uphill towards a small flat area to the south.

node.name: Foothills, South Riverbank
node.description: A small game trail runs here among the clumps of reeds sprouting between the stones along the riverbank. Majestic trees of pine and oak thrust high overhead from an upslope to the south, providing cover from the elements. The far bank, by contrast, is a barren, rocky waste of a cliff which stretches from the riverbank up to and beyond a stone road cut into the hillside.

node.name: Foothills, South Canyon Rim
node.description: Tall patches of grass and an occasional clump of reeds grow here among the smooth stones of the riverbank. A small game trail wends its way among the grasses, trailing from the flats to the east up a small incline running west along the beginnings of the southern canyon rim.

node.name: Foothills, Oak Tree
node.description: An ancient oak tree crowns the top of this hill, its wide branches arching high into the heavens to provide shelter for man and beast alike. Whatever kind soul planted the acorn from which it grew knew much of the magic within the earth, for here all seems a little kinder, a little quieter than whatever may occur on the hillsides below.

node.name: Foothills, Dell's Edge
node.description: A large cut-out of mountain and earth opens up near the southern edge of the dell. Granite rubble, too small to be of any use to the Dwarves who once worked this old quarry, marks the path through the tree-lined foothills. Up ahead, the opening to a dark cavern is blocked by a small wooden shack, its rickety door hanging limply from rusted hinges.

node.name: Foothills, Wooded Path
node.description: An unkempt path through the dark pines climbs the hill southward at a steep incline, while to the north it descends to a dusty road. Skeletal branches reach out like dark hands, threatening to grab and trip at any opportunity.

Cutting through the thick pines, an unkempt path climbs the hill southward at a steep incline, while to the north it descends to a dusty road. Gnarled, brittle branches reach out at all angles, threatening to grab and trip at any opportunity. Light filters through skeletal limbs, casting shadows on the ground litter in random patterns that change as the sun moves through the sky.

node.name: Foothills, Wooded Path
node.description: The trail rises steeply through the thinning trees to the south, giving travelers a workout heading either direction along the precipitous slope. Ground litter and the reduced visibility make footing treacherous at best as well as noticeably muffling noise underfoot. Cricket song fills the air, deafening at times, obscuring the otherwise gentle sounds of nighttime wildlife that might be present.

The angle of the path gives travelers a workout, navigating through the trees that thin toward the rise to the south. Ground litter makes footing treacherous at times as well as noticeably muffling noise underfoot. Despite the obvious lack of use to the area, the abundant sounds of wildlife indicate it is quite a thriving environment.

node.name: Foothills, Wooded Slope
node.description: Dark silhouettes of pine trees line the slope to the north, dropping downhill along a trail through the trees. The dim shades of night reveal a wide field, coloring everything below in subtle shades of grey. Soft grasses sway with the breezes rushing over the open plain, a path pressed into the ground leading from the tree line to a meadow in the distance.

Pine trees line the slope to the north, heading downhill along a trail to the dry road barely discernable through the trees. A wide field opens under the daytime sky, where soft grasses sway with the breezes rushing over the open plain. Soft grasses sway with the breezes rushing over the open plain, a path pressed into the ground leading from the tree line to a meadow in the distance.

node.name: Wildflower Meadow, Before the Gods
node.description: Wildflowers circle a leafy bush and a large, flat boulder, the surface of which is rounded due to years of exposure to the wind and rain. Lush grass blankets the ground like a living carpet that softens footfalls. A faint path heads toward the tree line to the north, while the field drops off elsewhere in the other directions.

node.name: Foothills, Pine Tree
node.description: Securing a comfortable perch, you survey the vast wilderness below. A sea of foliage blankets this part of Elanthia to protect it from the ravages of the seasons. To the south, the road below gasps its final breaths in the distance as it decays into oblivion. Beside you a nest of pine needles, long grass and scrub brush rests in the arms of its host. A sudden breeze causes a slight bending of the tree top as it resists yet another force of nature.

node.name: Foothills, River
node.description: Icy-cold water flows smoothly past the stones underfoot, adding its whispers to those of the winds blowing up the river canyon which stretches off to the west. The jumbled mass of a collapsed hillside on the north riverbank provides a stark contrast to the neat, rocky shores of the south. A fine view of the sheer eastern face of Sorrow's Reach is afforded by the open space of the river.

node.name: Foothills, North Riverbank
node.description: It appears that part of the northern hillside has recently given way, for a large tumble of rocks and splintered trees leads from the riverbank to a small ridge above. A few steps to the south flow the stony, cold waters of the river.

node.name: Flagstone, Burrow
node.description: Small scraps of cloth, driftwood, and various unidentifiable pieces of jetsam line the walls and floor of this dank, fetid burrow. A heavy odor almost seems to squeak 'Rodent!' in your nostrils with every reluctant breath you take, and the occasional scrabbling you hear in the recesses of the hole is certainly more than just your imagination.

node.name: Foothills, Stone Road
node.description: The smooth, grey flagstones of a well built road abruptly end here in a massive jumble of stone and broken trees, the remains of a hillside which has tumbled into the river below. Although there are signs someone has been digging to clear the debris, the only way the road may be traveled for now is to the west.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: The road angles steeply here in its cliffside trek through the mountains, making travel an exercise in caution. Occasional washes of dried mud, the remnants of water runoff from melting snows on the high slopes to the north, dirty the otherwise smooth stones. Several of the road's mighty flagstones appear to have fallen to the canyon floor below, victims of a long-ago collapse.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: A crumbled tower of black stone, pitted along its once smooth face, lies here in a great heap along the southern edge of the road. Several large, charred timbers jut from the pile like skeletal fingers, pointing at the heavens in mute accusation of a long-ago crime.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Entry
node.description: A black granite arch looks out upon the remains of a flagstone road that stretches west towards a tall spire of grey and black rock. Paired doors carved of solid onyx hang askew on broken hinges to either side of the arch, held upright by the remains of an avalanche recently tumbled down from the nearby hillside. The road continues through the arch and on into the darkness. A spluttering torch dimly illuminates the way in and downward.

A black granite arch looks out upon the remains of a flagstone road that stretches west towards a tall spire of grey and black rock. Paired doors carved of solid onyx hang askew on broken hinges to either side of the arch, held upright by the remains of an avalanche recently tumbled down from the nearby hillside. The road continues through the arch and on into the darkness, with light from the outside dimly illuminating the way in and downward.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Entry Hall
node.description: The smooth, finished walls of this tunnel mark it unmistakeably as a Dwarven clan home. Small, musty clouds of dust rise at the slightest movement, their presence attesting to the long-ago abandonment of this area by its creators.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Entry Hall
node.description: The spirits of an ancient people mutter softly with the echo of every sound that reverbrates through the tunnel. To one side of the path lists an abandoned oxcart, its axle rusted and split by long years of neglect. The highway makes another downward turn to the east and widens into a natural cavern.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Great Hall
node.description: Sparkling gems embedded in the ceiling high above refract torchlight upon the surrounding walls in bizarre, kaleidoscopic patterns. A starburst constructed of varying shades of marble dominates the center of the chamber floor, its surface curiously clean in stark contrast to the surrounding dust. Three small passages to the east lead further into the depths of the clan home.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Dusty Passage
node.description: The passage narrows here, the weight of the hillside seeming to bear down from above. Several doors are set seamlessly into the surrounding walls, distinguishable only by slight color variations in the stonework.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Dusty Passage
node.description: Gaezthen spheres in finely-worked silver sconces line the walls of the corridor at regular intervals. Vague outlines of doors mark the entrances to private dwellings.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Dim Corner
node.description: The light dims considerably at this juncture of the corridors. A tunnel leading to the east has collapsed into a massive pile of rubble, preventing further passage into the clan's stronghold.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Dank Tunnel
node.description: The soft burbling of an underground spring whispers from somewhere beyond the tunnel walls. A long patch of phosphoresecent scarlet fungus climbs one wall of the tunnel, the dim light it emits casting sunset hues upon the doors set into the granite.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Dank Tunnel
node.description: Water trickles from a hairline fracture along one wall, across the floor and under one of the doors lining the tunnel. A strong smell of decaying vegetation hangs in the air.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Council Chamber
node.description: A long, low table set with several wooden chairs curves before the forward edge of a slightly raised circular dais. Rotting tapestries hang behind the dais, their colors muted by age and further sullied by the great clouds of dust that kick up with every disturbance of the floor. A large steel door, covered with lime and streaks of rust, sits in a recess at the back of the chamber.

node.name: Abandoned Clan, Buried Treasures
node.description: A collection of finest Dwarven stonework fills this shop, stout furnishings that, while simple, will last several lifetimes.

node.name: Low Mountains, Cliff Wall
node.description: A wide stone road which stretches off to the east ends here at a sheer cliff wall, giving way to a decrepit wooden bridge that spans southward across a small gap in the canyon. From the cliff heights far above juts a small promontory of stone, behind which you can see a small cave leading into the mountains.

node.name: Low Mountains, River Bridge
node.description: The bridge on which you stand has definitely seen better days. Wide as two men are tall and the length of a large, fallen pine, it has dry-rotted from too many years of wet snows and blistering summer suns. A number of holes in the decomposed floorboards offer glimpses of the river below.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: A decrepit, flat wooden bridge crosses the canyon to the north. The bridge appears to be a hastily assembled substitute for the original stone bridge, the remains of which arch a few feet over the canyon on either side. A road of wide, grey flagstones winds southwest into the mountains.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: The ancient stone road winds ambitiously along the southern face of the mountain range, turning frequently in its effort to bypass obstacles thrown up by the steep, rocky slopes. Clumps of small stones and the occasional large boulder line the northern edge of the path, silently watching your passage.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: At times wide and flat, but most often a steep, winding path, the road here writhes snake-like in its travel through the rocky heights of the mountains. Much of the road is cloaked in shadow, as what light comes from above is oft blocked by the high, stony crags on either side of the twisting path.

node.name: Low Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: Great peaks of craggy grey stone, devoid of vegetation, rise above on all sides save for a steep, winding road that stumbles its way northeast down the mountain. The road's builders apparently decided at this point that passage over the mountains was impossible, for here the flagstones enter the gaping black maw of a tunnel.

node.name: Mountains, Tunnel
node.description: A soft glow emanates from the tunnel mouth before you, but the light quickly fades as it filters into the tunnel's malevolent, grasping blackness. To the west climb the silent, grey flagstones of the ancient road.

node.name: Mountains, Tunnel
node.description: Like a Will-O-Wisp waiting to lure the unwary to their doom, the dim circle of the tunnel exit glows in the distance below. Your only choices are a heavy eastern descent to freedom, or to trudge into the sucking blackness which lies a steep climb to the west.

node.name: Mountains, Tunnel
node.description: Darkness swirls and eddies about you like a malevolent fog, clutching greedily at your clothing as you feel your way along the ancient road. The stones underfoot are slick with moisture, and with each scrape of your feet whisper of unseen chasms ahead.

node.name: Mountains, Tunnel
node.description: A faint, glowing circle squats stolidly in the western firmaments above, indicating a steep climb to the freedom of open skies and fresh air. Other than your erstwhile lunar companion, the darkness here is absolute.

node.name: Mountains, Tunnel
node.description: What faint light manages to filter from the nearby tunnel mouth is quickly absorbed by the hungry blackness all around you. There is an odd rushing sound, akin to that of strong winds blowing through the tall trees of a forest, coming from outside the tunnel.

node.name: Mountains, Waterfall
node.description: You are on a wide plateau of stone, high above a mighty river gorge which slashes its way east into the distance. All around you towers the treeless, rocky spire of Sorrow's Reach, its stony roots curving protectively down around the canyon's western limits. A mighty river of white water bursts eagerly from a cavern mouth high upon the north face of the Reach, roaring forth to plummet into a wide pool in the depths of the canyon below.

node.name: Sorrow's Reach, Cliff Path
node.description: The path here is barely wide enough to accommodate a single person. The wall to the west offers little in the way of support, being nearly devoid of handgrips and just as slick as the rock below your feet. One slip of a foot to the east lies a drop into the reaches of infinity.

node.name: Mountains, Waterfall
node.description: A road of square grey flagstones begins here in a corner guarded to the west and north by the sheer cliffs of the Reach. The assembly of dull grey stones, shiny black where they have been chipped or worn smooth by passing traffic, stretch behind the waterfall to the east before winding their way up the mountainside.

node.name: Mountains, Behind Waterfall
node.description: The great roar of the river beast rushing from above beats upon your ears like a winter storm battering a coastal village. Although this small stone grotto would at first glance seem an ideal hiding place, its algae slickened floor and body soaking humidity make it unlikely anyone would use it as such.

node.name: Mountains, Waterfall
node.description: A sharp bend in the road provides a good vantage point for monitoring traffic passing near the waterfall to the west. Several large boulders border either side of the path, providing ample cover for would-be assailants.

node.name: Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: A slight sound of rushing water reaches your ears, complementing the smooth whisper of the winds which blow up the canyon and across the stony face of the Reach. The road here, level to the northwest, begins to climb slightly as it stretches to the east.

node.name: High Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: A gnarled, twisted pine, bent with age and stunted from a life far above the treeline, hangs precariously over the edge of the canyon rim as if considering an end to its pitiful existence. Something seems to have taken the signs of the tree's weakness as an invitation to attack, for most of its bark has been shredded away from its trunk in long, thin strips.

node.name: High Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: A sharp bend in the road has been rendered treacherous by the collapse of most of its surface into the canyon below. Only one width of flagstones remains at the narrowest point, and it appears that a great deal of the earth underneath has already washed away. Long, sharp scratches in the mountain wall bordering the road almost appear to be the frenzied digging of some creature intent on widening the passage.

node.name: High Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: Tall piles of small, black stones lie on either side of the road here, slowing passage along mountain. Several of the stones have been used to create a crude fire ring on the uphill side of the piles, and a few animal bones, picked clean of flesh, lie scattered about the area.

node.name: High Mountains, Stone Road
node.description: Weeds choke the cracks between mighty flagstones of coarse grey rock. The road here rises slightly to the north, while a bend to the southwest begins a torturous descent to the hills below. A rope bridge can be seen in the distance, stretching across the canyon from a rocky outcropping to the northeast.

node.name: Sorrow's Reach, Cavern Mouth
node.description: You are standing on a massive slab of flat, grey stone cut into one side of the Reach. The north and west walls are soaring towers of granite, while to the south and east lie sheer cliffs which stretch a lifetime's fall to the canyon floor below. A rope bridge, attached to a natural outcropping of stone, sways in the breeze above the canyon.

node.name: High Mountains, Rope Bridge
node.description: A sharp, cool wind tugs at your clothing as you stand upon this modest bridge of stick and rope. Far, far below you can see a small wooden bridge spanning the canyon, and even further beyond stretches a slight band of blue which you can only assume to be the river.

node.name: High Mountains, Rope Bridge
node.description: Ringed by dark clouds of grey, the massive, stony crag of Sorrow's Reach looms above you to the north like the thrusted fist of an angry earth-god. A deep river gorge has ripped its way through the lands at the base of the Reach, creating a formidable barrier to those who would scale its heights. The canyon would be nigh impossible to cross, were it not for a simple rope bridge which stretches across to a stone plateau in the mountainside.

node.name: High Mountains, Small Path
node.description: A small footpath wending its way from the north ends here at the top of what must have been a mighty avalanche indeed. Splintered trees and boulders the size of small houses lie jumbled together in a great rockslide which seems to reach all the way to the foothills below.

node.name: Promado Village, Mountain Pass
node.description: A small trail leading west through a tangled morass of weeds and brambles ends here at a soaring cliff wall, rent open by a narrow crack in its craggy face.

node.name: Promado Village, Middle of Pass
node.description: The pass winds and twists between rugged walls of dark stone, boulders precariously balanced on the cliffs far above. The numerous craters on the overgrown path, where chunks of rock lie embedded as deep as a foot into the stony soil, bear silent testimony to the danger here.

node.name: Promado Village, Mouth of Pass
node.description: The narrow pass through the mountainside changes shape here, widening into a valley to the west and squeezing into a narrow, rocky passage to the east. In the shadow of western cliffs stands a ruined village, ramshackle huts and crude wooden buildings standing empty and silent, not even the chirping of birds or the buzzing of insects relieving the eerie, dead stillness.

node.name: Promado Village, Broad Trail
node.description: A broad trail, weeds shooting up though the pebbled road, leads west into the center of the silent village. The mountain pass stands to the east, and a narrower, less-traveled path runs far to the southwest.

node.name: Promado Village, Village Boundary
node.description: The eastern boundary of the village proper is a tangled mass of dry grass and weed grown between piles of splintered boulders tumbled from the cliff face above. Tiny abandoned homes, most of them long ago flattened into kindling, lie scattered about the landscape. The tip of a black obelisk can be seen poking its head over two still-standing homes to the west.

node.name: Promado Village, East Circle
node.description: The eastern trail merges with a wide, circular boulevard here, broken cobblestones littered across upturned black soil. A tall, black obelisk looms in an open plaza to the west, encircled by the road that arches protectively around it.

node.name: Promado Village, Obelisk
node.description: A tall obsidian obelisk, chipped and cracked and sunken into the earth at a jagged lean, stands at the center of the village. Broken and abandoned buildings stand silently around the boulevard, dwarfed by the tall, crumbling facade of a church to the west.

node.name: Promado Village, West Circle
node.description: The west end of the boulevard runs before the tallest building in the village, a church sided with clapboard and peeling white paint. Several ruined homes stand in the shadow of the building's tall bell tower.

node.name: Promado Village, North Circle
node.description: North of the village monument, this part of the boulevard runs past a small, ramshackle building with two small obsidian obelisks sitting on its front porch. A smaller footpath, all that remains of a larger road, wends to the northwest through tall, dry grasses.

node.name: Promado Village, South Circle
node.description: South of the village monument, this part of the boulevard passes by the burnt-out shells of sad, empty houses. A smaller road stretches off to the south.

node.name: Promado Village, Cart Path
node.description: The path cuts through a grassy field, away from the village and towards a cluster of low, grey stones to the southwest. Deep gouges cut into the ground betray the passage of a heavily laden wagon.

node.name: Promado Village, Graveyard
node.description: Dozens of grey stones, many toppled flat and half-buried in the overgrown grass, lie scattered about the ground. Although most are faceless, half-legible inscriptions on one or two show them to be gravestones. The number of markers seems abnormally large for such a small village, and it is apparent from the crowds of newer stones jammed between the neatly ordered rows that many of the graves were dug in a short period of time.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Gate
node.description: The darkness of the night is intensified because of the shadowy presence of a high wall which blocks all views to the west. Creeping vines camouflage any odd protrusions from the ground, making the walk in the darkness a little more treacherous.

A lofty wall of some oddly colored green metal blocks the view west. All other directions lead to grim reminders of death and mortality. A low, creeping vine has taken over much of the open ground, but here and there, broken stumps of stone or metal protrude unevenly. A bare path made of thousands of tiny, rough pebbles leads northwest towards an irregular, slab-sided chapel.

node.name: Promado Village, Outside Cave
node.description: A multitude of smooth grey stones peep above the sea of grass here in the shadow of the cliff wall at the southern end of the valley. The dark mouth of a cave stands at the trail's end, a pair of deep wagon tracks leading right inside. A fetid smell drifts from the cave, something like a dead animal rotting.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Close-Packed Graves
node.description: The stillness of the night is occassionally broken by the sound of some unknown creature rustling through weeds and vines. The graves are barely visible in the darkness, their broken remains dark shadows in the night.

Numerous rows of grave markers stand side by side in oddly close array. Most are broken and overturned, but a few still stand upright. Tiny flowers grow amongst the stones, pale white and delicate. Their clean, sweet scent seems so out of place in this grim setting that it disturbs rather than uplifts.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Alabaster Fountain
node.description: The sound of trickling water emanates from the fountain that is barely visible in the dark. The shadowy silhouette looms against the night like a dark sentinel.

Surrounded by dozens of tiny grave markers, an elegant alabaster fountain stands, a monument to the silent dead. Here and there, some of the graves have been disturbed in a curious manner. The earth has been overturned, as if pushed up from below by some unseen force. Several tiny caskets lie tumbled about, broken and empty.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Close-Packed Graves
node.description: Dirt lies piled in uneven ridges, the remnants of overturned and unearthed graves scattered throughout the area. Shadows dance across the path in dark, ominous swirls that seem to mimic the movements of passersby.

Many small gravestones here are ruined and destroyed, perhaps by time and the weather, yet the wreckage seems systematic, as if someone had been searching for something buried. To the north, a long row of massive and elaborate obelisks and other shapes rise along the high wall of the cemetery.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Close-packed Graves
node.description: The stillness of the night is occasionally broken by the sound of some unknown creature rustling through weeds and vines. The graves are barely visible in the darkness, their broken remains dark shadows in the night.

Numerous rows of grave markers stand side by side in oddly close array. Most are broken and overturned, but a few still stand upright. Tiny flowers grow amongst the stones, pale white and delicate. Their clean, sweet scent seems so out of place in this grim setting that it disturbs rather than uplifts.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Burial Mounds
node.description: A series of dark green grassy mounds run along the cemetery wall. Some seem recently created, an oddity in this place that appears otherwise abandoned, while others appear to have existed for quite some time. A sense of uneasiness fills the air, perhaps caused by the heavy silence that permeates the area.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Burial Mounds
node.description: A series of dark green grassy mounds run along the cemetery wall. Some seem recently created, an oddity in this place that appears otherwise abandoned, while others appear to have existed for quite some time. A sense of uneasiness fills the air, perhaps caused by the heavy silence that permeates the area.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Funerary Memorials
node.description: The outlines of several stone monuments are barely visible, their shapes and features hidden by the darkness of the night. The sound of something moving echoes in the gloom, but the source of the disturbance never reveals itself.

Running along the high wall, many strange, even bizarre stone monuments rise, each striving to outdo the next in elaborate paeans to the forgotten dead rotting beneath. Many-winged beings raise a pot-bellied figure dressed as a Trader in mute exaltation. Dying warriors make bloody obeisance to a stoop-shouldered figure clad as a mighty warlord.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Funerary Memorials
node.description: Numerous monuments to the dead rise all about, each its own testament to the long forgotten corpses that lie buried beneath. The wind sighs in a hollow dirge, perhaps in keening tribute to the deceased.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Funerary Memorials
node.description: The outline of a singular granite figure towers over the rest of the memorials, its details hidden by the blackness of the night. Muffled sounds, perhaps an animal foraging for food, or perhaps something else entirely, fill the air.

Northwards, the land falls away rapidly in a sheer drop-off, leaving naught but an echoing vista of open air. Nearer at hand, one huge monument dominates the garish row of memorials along the high wall, though the heroic figure surmounting the pile of stone seems oddly distorted. The ground around it is dry and bare of dust and dirt, yet faint marks of something heavily-clawed mar the surface.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Bare Ground
node.description: The ground here is bare and devoid of all, except for faint marks etched in the stone paving here and there. The remains of numerous wooden and latticework frames still stand along the edge of the precipice, and in one place, a stone platform juts out over the edge.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Bare Ground
node.description: The crunching of gravel fills the air, though whatever is walking or moving along the ground cannot yet be seen. An odd rustling noise is carried from nearby, like the sound of some great bird shaking out its feathers in preparation for flight.
The ground here is barren and untended. Oddly, not one piece of grass or one flower grows anywhere. The walkway is mainly dirt and gravel, the footing at times treacherous.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Rock Platform
node.description: Tall wooden poles are set in regular groups deep into the stone. Many bits of bone and other identifiable remains lie scattered about. The air is heavy with the nearness of death, as though some great power or ritual had once been worked here.

Tall wooden poles are set in regular groups deep into the stone. Many bits of bone and other identifiable remains lie scattered about. The air is heavy with the nearness of death, as though some great power or ritual had once been worked here. Far off in the sky, a huge black bird glides on motionless wings, rising in slow circles, yet never straying far from this place.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Rocky Ground
node.description: Underfoot, the ground is hard and stony. No grave or monument rises here, as if the space had been left unused when this place of the dead was abandoned. Faint lines etched into the rock indicate where monuments might once have been placed. Nothing grows in the desolation, save one tiny tree that grows in a scant pocket of earth in the cracked stone.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Burial Mounds
node.description: Soft earth rises in low mounds all about. Some are topped with standing stones, but most are bare or scattered with rubble. There is a sweet smell of ancient mold and rot seeping into the air. Scabrous yellow flowers grow among piles of broken rock, and lichen the color of dried blood spatters the stony surfaces.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Burial Mounds
node.description: A series of dark green grassy mounds run along the cemetery wall. Some seem recently created, an oddity in this place that appears otherwise abandoned, while others appear to have existed for quite some time. A sense of uneasiness fills the air, perhaps caused by the heavy silence that permeates the area.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Burial Mounds
node.description: Along the high wall protecting this place, many low, mossy burial mounds stand. Few are marked in any way and fewer still seem intact. Almost all of them have been dug up, unearthed, or otherwise disturbed. Whether the desecration took place long ago or more recently is impossible to discern, and there is no hint as to its cause.

node.name: Promado Village, Cave Tunnel
node.description: The welcome light of day streams in through the mouth of this dank tunnel where it exits to a small, grassy valley. Further south, the rough stone floor slopes sharply downward, out of sight and closer to the stench of decay that pervades the gloom.

node.name: Promado Village, Tunnel Bend
node.description: The tunnel levels here from its steep slope to the north and turns sharply to the east. A pair of wagon tracks end abruptly at this point, their depth in the hard-packed earth suggesting the cart's burden was a very heavy one.

node.name: Promado Village, Dead Pit
node.description: The tunnel ends here at the brink of a vast pit, piled high with the bones of the dead. A sea of ashen bones and skeletal remains gleams in the dim light, eyeless sockets turned up to the earthen roof as if searching for release. From far beneath, perhaps at the bottom of the pit, comes a chorus of slithering, clicking noises, like a million wriggling centipedes nesting in the bones.

node.name: Luscious Lavas
node.description: Large slabs of crudely cut obsidian lie stacked in careful piles along the walls of this oak-paneled workshop. Small chips of flint-knapped stone litter the floor, ready to slice the feet of the unwary. A sign on the far wall invites attention.

node.name: Promado Village, Northern Lane
node.description: This path leads through a tangle of ruined and fallen huts, the only fragments and reminders of a once prosperous village. The worn footpath, fresh tracks still evident upon it, curves from the south to the northeast, where it disappears from view behind a ramshackle wooden building.

node.name: Promado Village, Refuse Heap
node.description: The footpath ends behind a large wooden building, where a refuse heap piled high with obsidian chips, broken hammerstones and various other garbage sits in silence. A long, ash-white bone juts from the bottom of the pile.

node.name: Promado Village, Southern Lane
node.description: This narrow, overgrown trail winds between rows of collapsed rubble mounds that might once have been homes. The trail continues southwest, and rejoins the main boulevard to the north.

node.name: Promado Village, End of Southern Lane
node.description: The lane comes to an end at a morass of bramble thickets here, rubble vanishing in the tall, wavering grass.

node.name: Promado Village, Southwestern Lane
node.description: Unlike the utter desolation due east, this street shows slight signs of rebirth cropping from the earth. Grass patches clump in front of the run-down houses. Above the squat shacks lining the south side of the road appears a modest-sized knoll, crowned by a building seething with plant growth.

node.name: Promado Village, Small Cottage
node.description: In stark contrast to the rest of this section of the lane, one whitewashed cottage stands snug and whole in the midst of the squalor, proving that is indeed possible to rise against and to conquer adversity. A deep-grained walnut door, graced with delicate unicorn and panther carvings, acts as entry into the abode.

node.name: Promado Village, Southwestern Lane
node.description: Clumps of daisies peek out of the earth, dwarfed by the remains of burnt buildings lined along the sides of the dirt path. A lone wooden sign dangles from the remains of one of the houses.

node.name: Promado Village, Knoll
node.description: The dirt road ends at the base of the knoll, changing into a cobblestone path leading up the tiny hill to a thatched-roof house. Vines cover the whitewashed structure in a tangle of shadows. Stray wildflowers show pale on the darkened hillside.

The dirt road ends at the base of a knoll, changing into a cobblestone path leading up the tiny hill to a thatched-roof house. Vines choke the whitewashed structure in a tangle of green tendrils. Stray wildflowers dot the hillside, struggling to create a spot of brightness amongst the remains of the rest of the village.

node.name: Promado Village, House on a Knoll
node.description: Queued up like a line in a Carousel, the cobblestones sweep in a broad arc from the bottom to the top of the knoll, ending at a quaint house. Several snakeweeds grow thickly around its perimeter, their oblong leaves jutting outwards as if to guide visitors away from the chestnut door leading inside.

node.name: Small Cottage, Living Area
node.description: Spotlessly clean, the small room contains only a table and four rickety chairs, a long cabinet with a washbasin perched on it, and a small fireplace built of rough-edged rock. The walls have been carefully patched in several places, and covered with a fresh coat of whitewash. Roughly sewn but bright and cheerful curtains hang at the window, and a teapot whistles softly from its hook in the hearth.

node.name: Small Cottage, Children's Bedroom
node.description: Painted in a now faded light blue, the walls provide a sense of serenity, accentuated by the mural of Hodierna and Damaris on the eastern wall. A small bed with a sleek panther carved on the deobar headboard sits beneath the window.

node.name: Small Cottage, Master Bedroom
node.description: A simple bed is pushed into the corner, covered with a faded but freshly washed comforter. Curtains have been drawn across a large window on the northern wall, closing out the night and the devastation of the surrounding village.

A simple bed is pushed into the corner, covered with a faded but freshly washed comforter. A large window on the northern wall gives a view of the church steeple rising from behind a ridge of tumbled rock not far off. From this distance, the devastation of the village is invisible, and one could believe it was still filled with friends and neighbors.

node.name: Promado Village, Tiny House
node.description: The ancient timbers of this one-room house creak and sway dangerously every time a wind blows through, as if it may collapse upon itself at any moment. The furniture has disintegrated into wooden shards and scraps of cloth, and the old fireplace is home to a massive spiderweb from which tiny scarlet eyes gleam.

node.name: Promado Village, Church of Hodierna
node.description: The church pews have been uprooted and stacked haphazardly against the walls, clearing the hardwood floor. A sense of deep gloom pervades the otherwise undamaged building, a vaguely bittersweet fragrance hanging in the air. A winding stair leads up to the bell tower, and a wooden door stands at the back of the room.

node.name: Promado Village, Cleric's Office
node.description: This lonely nook was once the village cleric's office, most of the furnishings now splintered to ruin. A length of rope, frayed and swinging in a slight draft of air, hangs from its knot around a ceiling beam in the center of the room. Beneath it, half-covered in dust, lies a tattered parchment note.

node.name: Promado Village, Bell Tower
node.description: A giant bronze bell, placed to be rung in times of celebration or danger, dominates the church belfry. It has remained silent for so long that a family of fist-sized spiders has taken up residence inside, their webs stretching from the bell to the clapper. The view from inside the belfry window shows the looming cliffs that tower over the village on all sides, and, not far to the north, the imposing black stone towers of Sorrow's Keep.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Mound Top
node.description: The outline of the village below is barely discernible in the dark of night. The slab that stands in the center of the mound looms in the darkness, an eerie sentinel against the night sky.

Here at the top of the mound, the center of Promado Village is seen. The church steeple is barely discernible, its white clapboard sides almost pristine as it stands next to several abandoned and demolished homes. The black slate slab stands in the center of the mound, larger than life. Around the base, someone has arranged rocks and sticks into some oddly-shaped symbols, their meaning long forgotten.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, Mound Top
node.description: Footing is treacherous here, as loose earth slides with each step. Bits of bone glint white against the bare dirt, and many broken weapons lie scattered, lost perhaps in some ancient battle. Slightly to the west stands a dull black slab that rises from the mire in the low center of the mound.

node.name: Abandoned Cemetery, High Mound
node.description: The eerie outline of the high mound looms against the backdrop of the dark night sky. Sounds drift from the top of the mound to echo in the night, their source unknown.

One mound, higher than all the others, looms over the cemetery like an ominous guardian. The top is crowned with a single massive standing stone of dull black slate. No grass grows here, yet the earth appears darkly rich. Faint footprints run across bare loam, and many drag marks criss-cross its surface, yet the silence that reigns over all yields no hint as to the source of the activity.

node.name: High Mountains, Obscured Trail
node.description: Dense, flower-laden bushes obscure the trail to the north, and a wide, rocky path leads toward the southeast. Several pockets in the face of the mountain look as if someone were recently mining in the area, leaving the path covered with various bits of metals.

node.name: High Mountains, Waterfall
node.description: Seeming to end here, the trail runs directly toward a waterfall that crashes down from a cave high up. Plummeting down forcefully with gouts of water, the trail washes away as a river flows from the falls and off another cliff toward the east.

node.name: High Mountains, Rocky Path
node.description: Unblemished by trees, the trail here gives a clear view of the sky. Splitting off to the south, a steep slope leads down to a small gully while the main trail continues eastward. The pathway hugs the side of the mountain tightly as it wends its way around, creating blind corners and steep drop offs.

node.name: High Mountains, Rocky Path
node.description: Making a sinuous bend through the mountains, the trail loops toward the south and into dense tree lines. The hardwoods cling to the terrain, raising into a thick forest that extends down the side of the mountain.

node.name: High Mountains, Behind the Waterfall
node.description: Hidden behind crashing torrents of water, the cavern opens up into a large area filled with stalactites and stalagmites. The echoing sound of dripping water is interrupted only by the occasional loud crash from the waterfall outside. Uneven ground leads further back into the mountain.

node.name: High Mountains, Cavern
node.description: Humid and stale air fills the cave along with the echos of dripping water and the distant sound of the roaring waterfall. Broken ground falls away in several areas, while others seem impassable due to the stalagmites in the area. A small flicker of light high up near the roof catches the eye, revealing a cliff with rudimentary footholds.

node.name: High Mountains, Sunfall Hub
node.description: Breaking open from the dank cavern below is a wide meadow neatly tucked in a valley between several surrounding mountains. Visible from this perch, a collection of huts and tents and rising smoke reveal signs of life from somewhere betwixt the structures. In the distance, several figures wander in and out of the circle of the buildings.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Claw District
node.description: Three large huts, constructed of stretched hide and wood encircle the area. Each marked with its own symbol, the huts appear to house both resident and visiting members of the Claws. Prydaen filter in and out each hut a few at a time, occasionally accompanied by an Elder.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Warrior District
node.description: Corralled in the area, several warriors spar, hone their weapons, or watch the others with avid interest. The younger Prydaen, oblivious to the danger of running through the vicinity, chase after small creatures in the area, squealing with glee when successful, and hissing with frustration when defeated.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Work Area
node.description: Like a shell-laden beach, the ground here is laden with a myriad of items from bones, broken beads, twine, and metal shavings. A large anvil rests next to a large forge that appears to double as a kiln. Several Prydaen nearby appear to be stripping carcasses or working away at various crafts.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Residential Area
node.description: Several hide tents and huts with thick straw roofs crop up across the grassy area. Dozing Prydaen pay little mind to the creatures that wander through, leaving the prowling teenagers to dispatch them.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Firepit Circle
node.description: At the dead center of the Hub, an expansive bonfire blazes, tended to by the resident Prydaen. Several groups gather in the area to exchange trade, words, or to simply stop and share a meal. Nearby, a small group of well-protected kits take instruction from two Claw members while nearby warriors keep a watchful eye on the area.

node.name: Sunfall Hub, Inside A Hide Tent
node.description: Built upon sturdy sets of stilts, several hammocks with thick pallets are suspended, waiting to hold the weary. A simple dirt floor is covered by thin hides, with a small rock encircled firepit set into the center of the room. A hide flap provides both entrance and exit to the room.

node.name: High Mountains, Sloped Path
node.description: Sprays of rock occasionally fall from up above, sending the gravel on the ground tumbling further down and into the undergrowth beneath the trees that somehow cling to life here. The trail veers toward both the east and the west from here, forking around a fairly sizable boulder.

node.name: High Mountains, Sloped Path
node.description: Looping to the north and the west, the trail here opens widely, providing a breathtaking view of the mountains in the distance. A ramshackle fence set up along the edge of the path seems to have been set up to prevent accidental deaths.

node.name: High Mountains, Sloped Path
node.description: Circling around the boulder, the rocky path is littered with dried out and broken logs. A series of small rocks line the path, and an oddly stacked bunch of rocks rests on the north side of the trail, as if serving as a trail marker.
